articles.title: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer says companies need to continue to invest despite tariff turmoil
articles.content: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer says companies need to continue to invest through tumultuous markets.

articles.title: The Score: Nike, Apple, Stellantis and More Stocks That Defined the Week
articles.content: MARKETS MAIN  The Score is a weekly review of the biggest stock moves and the news that drove them. Nike President Trump’s so-called “Liberation Day” tariff announcements wreaked havoc on the stock market.

articles.title: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Apple, Tesla, Nvidia, Boeing, DuPont, Intel, Nike, Affirm, and More
articles.content: Shares of Apple, Tesla, and Nvidia extend losses Friday after China says it will impose a 34% retaliatory tariff on all imported goods from the U.S.

articles.title: Nvidia, Apple, Tesla stocks plunge, leading another 'Magnificent 7' sell-off as a trade war intensifies
articles.content: Nvidia and Tesla led megacaps lower on Friday as stocks continued to sell off amid a global trade war.

articles.title: US Stock Market Wipes Out Over $5 Trillion on Trump’s Tariff War
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- The S&P 500 Index declined to the lowest level in 11 months, slashing $5.4 trillion in market value in just two sessions as Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said the Trump administration’s tariffs “could have a persistent impact on inflation.”Most Read from BloombergHousing Agency Aims to Relocate Its DC HeadquartersLocal Governments Vie for Fired Federal WorkersMetro-North Is Faster Than Acela on NYC-New Haven Route After Signal UpdatesWhat Would ‘Transportation Abundance’

articles.title: Apple Stock Falls Despite Speculation It Could Get A Tariff Exemption
articles.content: Apple stock tumbled for the second consecutive day on Friday amid fallout from the steep tariffs announced by President Donald Trump.

articles.title: Nike, Lululemon Rebound as Trump Touts Call With Vietnam Leader
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Shares in companies that have large manufacturing operations in Vietnam, including Nike Inc. and Lululemon Athletica Inc., soared Friday after President Donald Trump said Vietnam was willing to eliminate tariffs to avoid new US levies. articles.title: Apple Has No Place to Hide. Tariffs on China Are Just One Problem.
articles.content: All of Big Tech is feeling the heat from President Donald Trump’s latest tariffs and the escalating global trade war.  Every company has its own unique set of risks stemming from the radical shift in U.S. policy, but Apple faces battles on several fronts.  Indeed, the company has been flagging potential problems since early in Trump’s first term.

articles.title: TikTok deal put on hold after China indicated it would reject it over tariffs, sources say
articles.content: WASHINGTON -A deal to spin off the U.S. assets of TikTok was put on hold after China indicated it would not approve the deal following President Donald Trump's tariffs announcement this week,...
